column4: Hello. I bought a printer(Lexmark E260D), I installed the printer into the system by using the .ppd files I found on the printer's cd. The problem is, there are pdf files that are printer very quick in very good quality and there are other pdf files which take very very much time to go to the printer and the quality isn't so good. Why is this happening? Any ideas? I mean, I'm printing .pdf files, why some have good quality and other bad?
is other pdf more or less image scanned? sometimes that may occur too :)
thanks for your anser. What do you mean by image scanned? The .pdf with the bad printing quality was taken from a .ps file and made pdf
both plain text?
plain text is printed in very good quality and very fast
good. is there image on that "bad quality" 1
no, only tables and some strange mathematical symbols
hmm.. is the difference how big? i mean in time
yes, it could take 30 seconds for the printer to start printing one page. If there are two pages it takes much longer(1 minute +)
is there difference between sizes of those pdf's?
The one that is printed in bad quality is 75 pages and 412KB of size and the other is 4 pages and 28KB size
weird; when you look these documents on screen you see quality differences?
If I zoom up to 200% I think the one printed in bad quality has also worse quality in it's pdf than the other printed in good quality.
is documents scanned or wrote on text prormam? :)
the bad quality one doesn't seem scanned, It's like someone wrote it in latex and then did it in pdf. The one with the good quality seems to be writter in openoffice and then done to pdf
maybe latex gave bit too much black spots to document and printer tries to select which opints it prints and which not :)
Well, Is there a way to fix this if we have the .ps for example of the file? :S (I didn't quite understand what you said)
i dont thinks that there is straight way to boost quality but im looking in ut
Well, thank you very much for your help! I tried some other .pdf files too and they are being printed very well, so I guess the one .pdf I tried doesn't have so good quality
as you said
latex makes pdf part from bitmap image and sometimes quality sucks
ok. thank you very much for your time and help ;)
